segment.source: Analysis Tab
segment.target: Analysis Tab

segment.source: Analysis Tab
segment.target: Analysis Tab

segment.source: Analysis Tab
segment.target: Analysis Tab

segment.source: The Analysis tab is the central workspace of Windows Performance Analyzer (WPA).
segment.target: The Analysis tab is the central workspace of Windows Performance Analyzer (WPA).

segment.source: To analyze a recording, you can drag graph thumbnails from the Graph Explorer window onto this tab.
segment.target: To analyze a recording, you can drag graph thumbnails from the Graph Explorer window onto this tab.

segment.source: At the left side of each graph is a legend that labels the lines or bars on the graph and an associated data table.
segment.target: At the left side of each graph is a legend that labels the lines or bars on the graph and an associated data table.

segment.source: The data table shows the graph data in tabular form.
segment.target: The data table shows the graph data in tabular form.

segment.source: The following illustration shows the Analysis tab with two graphs open.
segment.target: The following illustration shows the Analysis tab with two graphs open.

segment.source: wpa analysis tab with two graphs
segment.target: wpa analysis tab with two graphs

segment.source: Using the Analysis Tab
segment.target: Using the Analysis Tab

segment.source: On the right side of the graph title bar are three layout icons.
segment.target: On the right side of the graph title bar are three layout icons.

segment.source: To view the graph and table, click the left-most icon.
segment.target: To view the graph and table, click the left-most icon.

segment.source: To view the data table with a thumbnail view of the graph, click the middle icon.
segment.target: To view the data table with a thumbnail view of the graph, click the middle icon.

segment.source: To view the graph alone, click the right-most icon.
segment.target: To view the graph alone, click the right-most icon.

segment.source: At the bottom of the Analysis tab is a timeline that applies to all graphs on the tab.
segment.target: At the bottom of the Analysis tab is a timeline that applies to all graphs on the tab.

segment.source: If you zoom in to a time interval on one graph, WPA synchronizes all graphs, the timeline, and the data tables.
segment.target: If you zoom in to a time interval on one graph, WPA synchronizes all graphs, the timeline, and the data tables.

segment.source: You can zoom in on a time interval repeatedly to view fine detail.
segment.target: You can zoom in on a time interval repeatedly to view fine detail.

segment.source: For more information about zooming, see Zoom In on a Time Interval.
segment.target: For more information about zooming, see Zoom In on a Time Interval.

segment.source: To search for text in the data tables or to filter the data that is displayed in the graphs and tables, right-click the data table.
segment.target: To search for text in the data tables or to filter the data that is displayed in the graphs and tables, right-click the data table.

segment.source: For more information, see Customize a Data Table and Search or Filter Data.
segment.target: For more information, see Customize a Data Table and Search or Filter Data.

segment.source: To increase the size of the Analysis tab, you can drag the surrounding panes into separate windows or close them altogether.
segment.target: To increase the size of the Analysis tab, you can drag the surrounding panes into separate windows or close them altogether.

segment.source: For more information, see Change the View Layout.
segment.target: For more information, see Change the View Layout.

segment.source: Opening a New Analysis Tab
segment.target: Opening a New Analysis Tab

segment.source: You can open a new Analysis tab without losing the one that you already have open.
segment.target: You can open a new Analysis tab without losing the one that you already have open.

segment.source: For more information, see Change the View Layout.
segment.target: For more information, see Change the View Layout.

segment.source: Use the Analysis tab to view Issue Details
segment.target: Use the Analysis tab to view Issue Details

segment.source: Layout options are available on the right edge of the Issue Details title bar.
segment.target: Layout options are available on the right edge of the Issue Details title bar.

segment.source: To view only the Issue Details, click the Maximize icon.
segment.target: To view only the Issue Details, click the Maximize icon.

segment.source: Additionally, you can use Display table only.
segment.target: Additionally, you can use Display table only.

segment.source: To increase the size of the Analysis tab, you can drag the surrounding panes into separate windows or close them altogether.
segment.target: To increase the size of the Analysis tab, you can drag the surrounding panes into separate windows or close them altogether.

segment.source: For more information, see Change the View Layout.
segment.target: For more information, see Change the View Layout.

segment.source: When the search options in the Issues Window change, the same list of issues is presented in the Issue Details window.
segment.target: When the search options in the Issues Window change, the same list of issues is presented in the Issue Details window.

segment.source: Your search will also change the zoom level of all the graphs on the tab to reflect the time intervals that are impacted by the Issues that are displayed.
segment.target: Your search will also change the zoom level of all the graphs on the tab to reflect the time intervals that are impacted by the Issues that are displayed.

segment.source: To search for specific issues, or to filter by a particular Issue category, see Issues Window.
segment.target: To search for specific issues, or to filter by a particular Issue category, see Issues Window.

segment.source: For more information about the contents of each detected issue, see Windows Assessment Toolkit Technical Reference.
segment.target: For more information about the contents of each detected issue, see Windows Assessment Toolkit Technical Reference.
